getWalletNFTs.description:
Get NFTs owned by a given address.
* The response will include status [SYNCED/SYNCING] based on the contracts being indexed.
* Use the token_address param to get results for a specific contract only
* Note that results will include all indexed NFTs
* Any request that includes the token_address param will start the indexing process for that NFT collection the very first time it is requested.

pathParams.name: address
pathParams.description: The address of the wallet

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: format
queryParams.description: The format of the token ID

queryParams.name: limit
queryParams.description: The desired page size of the result.

queryParams.name: token_addresses
queryParams.description: The addresses to get balances for (optional)

queryParams.name: cursor
queryParams.description: The cursor returned in the previous response (used for getting the next page).

queryParams.name: normalizeMetadata
queryParams.description: Should normalized metadata be returned?

responses.description: Returns a collection of NFT owners

field.name: status
field.description: The syncing status of the address [SYNCING/SYNCED]

field.name: total
field.description: The total number of matches for this query

field.name: page
field.description: The current page of the result

field.name: page_size
field.description: The number of results per page

field.name: cursor
field.description: The cursor to get to the next page

getMultipleNFTs.description:
Returns an array of NFTs specified in the request.
* The response will include status [SYNCED/SYNCING] based on the contracts being indexed.
* Use the token_address param to get results for a specific contract only
* Note that results will include all indexed NFTs
* Any request that includes the token_address param will start the indexing process for that NFT collection the very first time it is requested.

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

responses.description: Returns a collection of NFT owners

getWalletNFTTransfers.description: Get transfers of NFTs given the wallet and other parameters.

pathParams.name: address
pathParams.description: The wallet address of the sender or recipient of the transfers

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: format
queryParams.description: The format of the token ID

queryParams.name: direction
queryParams.description: The transfer direction

queryParams.name: from_block
queryParams.description:
The minimum block number from which to get the transfers
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: to_block
queryParams.description: To get the reserves at this block number

queryParams.name: limit
queryParams.description: The desired page size of the result.

queryParams.name: cursor
queryParams.description: The cursor returned in the previous response (used for getting the next page).

responses.description: Returns a collection of NFT transfers

field.name: total
field.description: The total number of matches for this query

field.name: page
field.description: The current page of the result

field.name: page_size
field.description: The number of results per page

field.name: cursor
field.description: The cursor to get to the next page

field.name: block_exists
field.description: Indicator if the block exists

field.name: index_complete
field.description: Indicator if the block is fully indexed

getContractNFTs.description:
Get NFTs for a given contract address, including metadata for all NFTs (where available).
* Results are limited to 100 per page by default
* Requests for contract addresses not yet indexed will automatically start the indexing process for that NFT collection.

pathParams.description: The address of the NFT contract

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: format
queryParams.description: The format of the token ID

queryParams.name: totalRanges
queryParams.description: The number of subranges to split the results into

queryParams.name: range
queryParams.description: The desired subrange to query

queryParams.name: cursor
queryParams.description: The cursor returned in the previous response (used for getting the next page).

queryParams.name: normalizeMetadata
queryParams.description: Should normalized metadata be returned?

responses.description: Returns a collection of NFTs

field.name: total
field.description: The total number of matches for this query

field.name: page
field.description: The current page of the result

field.name: page_size
field.description: The number of results per page

field.name: cursor
field.description: The cursor to get to the next page

getNFTTransfersFromToBlock.description: Get transfers of NFTs from a block number to a block number.

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: from_block
queryParams.description:
The minimum block number from which to get the transfers
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: to_block
queryParams.description:
The maximum block number from which to get the transfers.
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: from_date
queryParams.description:
The start date from which to get the transfers (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: to_date
queryParams.description:
The end date from which to get the transfers (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: format
queryParams.description: The format of the token ID

queryParams.name: limit
queryParams.description: The desired page size of the result.

queryParams.name: cursor
queryParams.description: The cursor returned in the previous response (for getting the next page)

responses.description: Returns a collection of NFT transfers

field.name: total
field.description: The total number of matches for this query

field.name: page
field.description: The current page of the result

field.name: page_size
field.description: The number of results per page

getNFTTrades.description: Get trades of NFTs for a given contract and marketplace.

pathParams.name: address
pathParams.description: The address of the NFT contract

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: from_block
queryParams.description:
The minimum block number from which to get the transfers
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: to_block
queryParams.description: The block number to get the trades from

queryParams.name: from_date
queryParams.description:
The start date from which to get the transfers (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: to_date
queryParams.description:
The end date from which to get the transfers (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: provider_url
queryParams.description: The web3 provider URL to use when using local dev chain

queryParams.name: marketplace
queryParams.description: Marketplace from which to get the trades (only OpenSea is supported at the moment)

queryParams.name: cursor
queryParams.description: The cursor returned in the previous response (used for getting the next page).

queryParams.name: limit
queryParams.description: The desired page size of the result.

responses.description: Returns the trades

field.name: total
field.description: The total number of matches for this query

field.name: page
field.description: The current page of the result

field.name: page_size
field.description: The number of results per page

Get NFT data, including metadata (where available), for the given NFT token ID and contract address.

field.name: token_id
field.description: The token ID of the NFT

field.name: owner_of
field.description: The wallet address of the owner of the NFT

field.name: token_hash
field.description: The token hash

field.name: block_number
field.description: The block number when the amount or owner changed

field.name: block_number_minted
field.description: The block number when the NFT was minted

field.name: contract_type
field.description: The type of NFT contract standard

field.name: token_uri
field.description: The URI to the metadata of the token

field.name: metadata
field.description: The metadata of the token

field.name: normalized_metadata
field.description: A normalized metadata version of the NFT's metadata.

field.name: minter_address
field.description: The address that minted the NFT

field.name: last_token_uri_sync
field.description: When the token_uri was last updated

field.name: last_metadata_sync
field.description: When the metadata was last updated

field.name: amount
field.description: The quantity of this item that the user owns (used by ERC1155)

field.name: name
field.description: The name of the NFT contract

field.name: symbol
field.description: The symbol of the NFT contract

syncNFTContract.description: Initiates a sync of a previously non synced contract.

pathParams.name: address
pathParams.description: The address of the NFT contract

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

responses.description: Contract address was triggered for index.

reSyncMetadata.description:
Resync the metadata for an NFT
* The metadata flag will request the NFT's metadata from an already existing token_uri
* The uri (default) flag will fetch the latest token_uri from the given NFT contract address. In sync mode the metadata will also be fetched
* The sync mode will make the endpoint synchronous so it will wait for the task to be completed before responding
* The async mode (default) will make the endpoint asynchronous so we will wait for the task to be completed before responding

pathParams.name: address
pathParams.description: The address of the NFT contract

pathParams.name: token_id
pathParams.description: The ID of the token

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: flag
queryParams.description: The type of resync to operate

queryParams.name: mode
queryParams.description: To define the behaviour of the endpoint

responses.description: (In sync mode) Resync request executed.

field.name: status
field.description: The status of the resync request

responses.description: The resync request was received and will be executed.

field.name: status
field.description: The status of the resync request

responses.description: (In sync mode) Resync request executed and metadata could not be updated.

field.name: status
field.description: The status of the resync request

getNFTLowestPrice.description: Get the lowest executed price for an NFT contract for the last x days (only trades paid in ETH).

pathParams.name: address
pathParams.description: The address of the NFT contract

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: days
queryParams.description:
The number of days to look back to find the lowest price
If not provided 7 days will be the default

queryParams.name: provider_url
queryParams.description: The web3 provider URL to use when using local dev chain

queryParams.name: marketplace
queryParams.description: Marketplace from which to get the trades (only OpenSea is supported at the moment)

responses.description: Returns the trade with the lowest price

field.name: transaction_hash
field.description: The transaction hash

field.name: transaction_index
field.description: The transaction index

field.name: token_ids
field.description: The token ID(s) traded

field.name: seller_address
field.description: The address that sold the NFT

field.name: buyer_address
field.description: The address that bought the NFT

field.name: marketplace_address
field.description: The address of the contract that traded the NFT

field.name: price
field.description: The value that was sent in the transaction (ETH/BNB/etc..)

field.name: block_timestamp
field.description: The block timestamp

field.name: block_number
field.description: The block number of the transaction

field.name: block_hash
field.description: The block hash

searchNFTs.description: Get NFTs that match a given metadata search query.

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: format
queryParams.description: The format of the token ID

queryParams.name: q
queryParams.description: The search string

queryParams.name: filter
queryParams.description: What fields the search should match on. To look into the entire metadata set the value to 'global'. To have a better response time you can look into a specific field like name

queryParams.name: from_block
queryParams.description:
The minimum block number from which to start the search
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: to_block
queryParams.description:
The maximum block number from which to end the search
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: from_date
queryParams.description:
The date from which to start the search (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: to_date
queryParams.description:
Get search results up until this date (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.

queryParams.name: addresses
queryParams.description: The addresses to get metadata for

queryParams.name: cursor
queryParams.description: The cursor returned in the previous response (used for getting the next page).

queryParams.name: limit
queryParams.description: The desired page size of the result.

responses.description: Returns the matching NFTs

field.name: total
field.description: The total number of matches for this query

field.name: page
field.description: The current page of the result

field.name: page_size
field.description: The number of results per page

getContractLogs.description: Get the logs for a contract.

pathParams.name: address
pathParams.description: The address of the contract

queryParams.name: chain
queryParams.description: The chain to query

queryParams.name: subdomain
queryParams.description: The subdomain of the Moralis server to use (only use when selecting local devchain as chain)

queryParams.name: block_number
queryParams.description:
The block number
* Provide the param 'block_numer' or ('from_block' and / or 'to_block')
* If 'block_numer' is provided in combination with 'from_block' and / or 'to_block', 'block_number' will will be used

queryParams.name: from_block
queryParams.description:
The minimum block number from which to get the logs
* Provide the param 'block_numer' or ('from_block' and / or 'to_block')
* If 'block_numer' is provided in combination with 'from_block' and / or 'to_block', 'block_number' will will be used

queryParams.name: to_block
queryParams.description:
The maximum block number from which to get the logs
* Provide the param 'block_numer' or ('from_block' and / or 'to_block')
* If 'block_numer' is provided in combination with 'from_block' and / or 'to_block', 'block_number' will will be used

queryParams.name: from_date
queryParams.description:
The start date from which to get the logs (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'from_block' or 'from_date'
* If 'from_date' and 'from_block' are provided, 'from_block' will be used.
* If 'from_date' and the block params are provided, the block params will be used. Please refer to the blocks params sections (block_number,from_block and to_block) on how to use them

queryParams.name: to_date
queryParams.description:
Get the logs up to this date (any format that is accepted by momentjs)
* Provide the param 'to_block' or 'to_date'
* If 'to_date' and 'to_block' are provided, 'to_block' will be used.
* If 'to_date' and the block params are provided, the block params will be used. Please refer to the blocks params sections (block_number,from_block and to_block) on how to use them

Fetch the pair data of the provided token0+token1 combination.

balance.description: Gets the native balance owned by a given network and address.
